alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Norton; Sheridan (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 1:21AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Norton, northeastern Sheridan and southern Decatur Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 120 AM CDT, the public reported a strong thunderstorm 4 miles south of Oberlin, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Mesonet. Oberlin Airport gusted to 50 mph at 120 AM CDT. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Dresden around 140 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Jennings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
